title: Hero father, 53, drowns trying to save his 14-year-old from a rip at Urunga beach
text:
A hero father has drowned trying to save his 14-year-old son from a rip at a beach.

The boy started struggling while swimming at Urunga beach on the New South Wales mid north coast at about 11.30am on Sunday.

His 53-year-old father headed into the ocean to rescue him, but got into trouble himself.

A hero father has drowned trying to save his 14-year-old son from a rip at a beach

The boy started struggling while swimming at Urunga beach on the New South Wales mid north coast at about 11.30am on Sunday. Emergency services are seen at the beach

Surf lifesavers were called to the unpatrolled beach and pulled the man from the water, but he could not be saved.

The 14-year-old boy was able to swim out of the rip and was uninjured.

Urunga beach is notorious for its rips, despite the water appearing to be calm.
description: The boy started struggling while swimming at Urunga beach on the New South Wales mid north coast at about 11.30am on Sunday.
